newsitem.title: USA: New York Times Co to sell publishing unit.
newsitem.headline: New York Times Co to sell publishing unit.

text.p: The New York Times Co said Sunday it was selling the assets of NYT Custom Publishing, its division that produces custom-designed magazines for clients under contract.
The company said the Jordan, Edmiston Group Inc, an investment bank that specializes in publishing and information transactions, will assist in the sale.
It did not give a price.
Custom Publishing, which had 1996 revenues of $13.7 million, is based in New York and produces seven magazines for customers including Beyond Computing and Think Leadership for IBM Corp, it said.

The division is not a part of the company's Magazine Group, which is a separate operating unit based in Trumbull, Connecticut and which includes nine consumer and trade sports magazines, and a sports marketing operation, it added.

The New York Times Co is a media company owning newspapers, magazines, television and radio stations, and electronic information and publishing services with annual revenues totalling more than $2.0 billion.
